verses.verse: וַיְהִי֙ <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi came בַּיָּמִ֣ים <S%H3117><s%> bai-ya-Mim And it came to pass in those days הָהֵ֔ם <S%H1992><s%> ha-Hem, those וּמֶ֖לֶךְ <S%H4428><s%> u-Me-lech when [there was] no king אֵ֣ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein there בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל <S%H3478><s%> be-Yis-ra-'El; in Israel וַיְהִ֣י׀ <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi came אִ֣ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'ish that there was a certain לֵוִ֗י <S%H3881><s%> le-Vi, Levite גָּ֚ר <S%H1481><s%> gar sojourning בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֣י <S%H3411><s%> be-yar-ke-Tei on the side הַר־ <S%H2022><s%> har- of mount אֶפְרַ֔יִם <S%H669><s%> 'ef-Ra-yim, Ephraim וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ <S%H3947><s%> vai-yik-kach- who took לוֹ֙ lo אִשָּׁ֣ה <S%H802><s%> 'ish-Shah ess פִילֶ֔גֶשׁ <S%H6370><s%> fi-Le-gesh, A concubine מִבֵּ֥ית mib-Beit לֶ֖חֶם <S%H1035><s%> Le-chem Bethlehem יְהוּדָֽה׃ <S%H3063><s%> ye-hu-Dah. Judah

וַתִּזְנֶ֤ה <S%H2181><s%> vat-tiz-Neh played the whore עָלָיו֙ <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lav against פִּֽילַגְשׁ֔וֹ <S%H6370><s%> pi-lag-Sho, And his concubine וַתֵּ֤לֶךְ <S%H1980><s%> vat-Te-lech went מֵֽאִתּוֹ֙ <S%H853><s%> me-'it-To אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about בֵּ֣ית <S%H1004><s%> beit house אָבִ֔יהָ <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi-ha, from him unto her father's אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about בֵּ֥ית beit לֶ֖חֶם <S%H1035><s%> Le-chem Bethlehem יְהוּדָ֑ה <S%H3063><s%> ye-hu-Dah; Judah וַתְּהִי־ <S%H1961><s%> vat-te-hi- become שָׁ֕ם <S%H8033><s%> sham was there יָמִ֖ים <S%H3117><s%> ya-Mim A period אַרְבָּעָ֥ה <S%H702><s%> 'ar-ba-'Ah and was there four חֳדָשִֽׁים׃ <S%H2320><s%> cho-da-Shim. months

וַיָּ֨קָם <S%H6965><s%> vai-Ya-kom arose אִישָׁ֜הּ <S%H376><s%> 'i-Shah And her husband וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ <S%H1980><s%> vai-Ye-lech and went אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ <S%H310><s%> 'a-cha-Rei-ha, after לְדַבֵּ֤ר <S%H1696><s%> le-dab-Ber her to speak עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- and לִבָּהּ֙ <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bah friendly; לַהֲשִׁיבֹו la-ha-shi-vov כלַהֲשִׁיבָ֔הּ <S%H7725><s%> la-ha-shi-Vah, break קוְנַעֲר֥וֹ <S%H5288><s%> ve-na-'a-Ro having his servant עִמּ֖וֹ <S%H5973><s%> im-Mo and a וְצֶ֣מֶד <S%H6776><s%> ve-Tze-med with him and a couple חֲמֹרִ֑ים <S%H2543><s%> cha-mo-Rim; of asses וַתְּבִיאֵ֙הוּ֙ <S%H935><s%> vat-te-vi-'E-hu and she brought בֵּ֣ית <S%H1004><s%> beit house אָבִ֔יהָ <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi-ha, him into her father's וַיִּרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ <S%H7200><s%> vai-yir-'E-hu saw אֲבִ֣י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi and when the father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah, of the damsel וַיִּשְׂמַ֖ח <S%H8055><s%> vai-yis-Mach him he rejoiced לִקְרָאתֽוֹ׃ <S%H7125><s%> lik-ra-To. to meet

וַיֶּחֱזַק־ <S%H2388><s%> vai-ye-che-zak- retained בּ֤וֹ bo חֹֽתְנוֹ֙ <S%H2859><s%> cho-te-No And his father in law אֲבִ֣י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah, the damsel's וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב <S%H3427><s%> vai-Ye-shev him and he abode אִתּ֖וֹ <S%H854><s%> it-To for שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת <S%H7969><s%> she-Lo-shet with him three יָמִ֑ים <S%H3117><s%> ya-Mim; days וַיֹּאכְלוּ֙ <S%H398><s%> vai-yo-che-Lu so they did eat וַיִּשְׁתּ֔וּ <S%H8354><s%> vai-yish-Tu, and drink וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ <S%H3885><s%> vai-ya-Li-nu and lodged שָֽׁם׃ <S%H8033><s%> Sham. there

וַֽיְהִי֙ <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi become בַּיּ֣וֹם <S%H3117><s%> bai-Yom day הָרְבִיעִ֔י <S%H7243><s%> ha-re-vi-'I, And it came to pass on the fourth וַיַּשְׁכִּ֥ימוּ <S%H7925><s%> vai-yash-Ki-mu when they arose early בַבֹּ֖קֶר <S%H1242><s%> vab-Bo-ker in the morning וַיָּ֣קָם <S%H6965><s%> vai-Ya-kom that he rose up לָלֶ֑כֶת <S%H1980><s%> la-Le-chet; to go וַיֹּאמֶר֩ <S%H559><s%> vai-yo-Mer said אֲבִ֨י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֜ה <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah and the damsel's אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to his חֲתָנ֗וֹ <S%H2860><s%> cha-ta-No, unto his son in law סְעָ֧ד <S%H5582><s%> se-'Ad Comfort לִבְּךָ֛ <S%H3820><s%> lib-be-Cha thine heart פַּת־ <S%H6595><s%> pat- with a morsel לֶ֖חֶם <S%H3899><s%> Le-chem of bread וְאַחַ֥ר <S%H310><s%> ve-'a-Char and afterward תֵּלֵֽכוּ׃ <S%H1980><s%> te-Le-chu. may go

וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ <S%H3427><s%> vai-ye-she-Vu, And they sat down וַיֹּאכְל֧וּ <S%H398><s%> vai-yo-che-Lu and did eat שְׁנֵיהֶ֛ם <S%H8147><s%> she-nei-Hem both יַחְדָּ֖ו <S%H3162><s%> yach-Dav of them together וַיִּשְׁתּ֑וּ <S%H8354><s%> vai-yish-Tu; and drink וַיֹּ֜אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer had said אֲבִ֤י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָה֙ <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah for the damsel's אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to הָאִ֔ישׁ <S%H376><s%> ha-'Ish, unto the man הֽוֹאֶל־ <S%H2974><s%> ho-'el- Be content נָ֥א <S%H4994><s%> na Please וְלִ֖ין <S%H3885><s%> ve-Lin I pray thee and tarry all night וְיִטַ֥ב <S%H3190><s%> ve-yi-Tav be merry לִבֶּֽךָ׃ <S%H3820><s%> lib-Be-cha. and let thine heart

וַיָּ֥קָם <S%H6965><s%> vai-Ya-kom rose up הָאִ֖ישׁ <S%H376><s%> ha-'Ish And when the man לָלֶ֑כֶת <S%H1980><s%> la-Le-chet; to go וַיִּפְצַר־ <S%H6484><s%> vai-yif-tzar- urged בּוֹ֙ bo חֹתְנ֔וֹ <S%H2859><s%> cho-te-No, his father in law וַיָּ֖שָׁב <S%H7725><s%> vai-Ya-shov there again וַיָּ֥לֶן <S%H3885><s%> vai-Ya-len him therefore he lodged שָֽׁם׃ <S%H8033><s%> Sham. there

וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם <S%H7925><s%> vai-yash-Kem And he arose early בַּבֹּ֜קֶר <S%H1242><s%> bab-Bo-ker in the morning בַּיּ֣וֹם <S%H3117><s%> bai-Yom day הַחֲמִישִׁי֮ <S%H2549><s%> ha-cha-mi-Shi on the fifth לָלֶכֶת֒ <S%H1980><s%> la-le-Chet to go וַיֹּ֣אמֶר׀ <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer said אֲבִ֣י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ה <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah, and the damsel's סְעָד־ <S%H5582><s%> se-'od- Comfort נָא֙ <S%H4994><s%> na Please לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ <S%H3824><s%> le-Va-ve-cha, thine heart וְהִֽתְמַהְמְה֖וּ <S%H4102><s%> ve-hit-mah-me-Hu I pray thee And they tarried עַד־ <S%H5704><s%> 'ad- until נְט֣וֹת <S%H5186><s%> ne-Tot afternoon הַיּ֑וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom; day וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ <S%H398><s%> vai-yo-che-Lu and they did eat שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ <S%H8147><s%> she-nei-Hem. both

וַיָּ֤קָם <S%H6965><s%> vai-Ya-kom rose up הָאִישׁ֙ <S%H376><s%> ha-'Ish And when the man לָלֶ֔כֶת <S%H1980><s%> la-Le-chet, that thou mayest go ה֥וּא <S%H1931><s%> hu he וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ <S%H6370><s%> u-fi-lag-Sho he and his concubine וְנַעֲר֑וֹ <S%H5288><s%> ve-na-'a-Ro; and his servant וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer said ל֣וֹ lo חֹתְנ֣וֹ <S%H2859><s%> cho-te-No his father in law אֲבִ֣י <S%H1><s%> 'a-Vi father הַֽנַּעֲרָ֡ה <S%H5291><s%> han-na-'a-Rah the damsel's הִנֵּ֣ה <S%H2009><s%> hin-Neh Behold נָא֩ <S%H4994><s%> na now רָפָ֨ה <S%H7503><s%> ra-Fah draweth הַיּ֜וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom unto him Behold now the day לַעֲרֹ֗ב <S%H6150><s%> la-'a-Ro, toward evening לִֽינוּ־ <S%H3885><s%> li-nu- I pray you tarry all night נָ֞א <S%H4994><s%> na please הִנֵּ֨ה <S%H2009><s%> hin-Neh Lo חֲנ֤וֹת <S%H2583><s%> cha-Not groweth to an end הַיּוֹם֙ <S%H3117><s%> hai-yOm behold the day לִ֥ין <S%H3885><s%> lin lodge פֹּה֙ <S%H6311><s%> poh here וְיִיטַ֣ב <S%H3190><s%> ve-yi-Tav may be merry לְבָבֶ֔ךָ <S%H3824><s%> le-va-Ve-cha, here that thine heart וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֤ם <S%H7925><s%> ve-hish-kam-Tem get you early מָחָר֙ <S%H4279><s%> ma-Char and to morrow לְדַרְכְּכֶ֔ם <S%H1870><s%> le-dar-ke-Chem, on your way וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ <S%H1980><s%> ve-ha-lach-Ta you may go לְאֹהָלֶֽךָ׃ <S%H168><s%> le-'o-ha-Le-cha. home

וְלֹֽא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo- was not אָבָ֤ה <S%H14><s%> 'a-Vah would הָאִישׁ֙ <S%H376><s%> ha-'Ish But the man לָל֔וּן <S%H3885><s%> la-Lun, not tarry that night וַיָּ֣קָם <S%H6965><s%> vai-Ya-kom but he rose up וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ <S%H1980><s%> vai-Ye-lech, and departed וַיָּבֹא֙ <S%H935><s%> vai-ya-Vo and came עַד־ <S%H5704><s%> 'ad- to נֹ֣כַח <S%H5227><s%> No-chach over against יְב֔וּס <S%H2982><s%> ye-Vus, Jebus הִ֖יא <S%H1931><s%> hi he יְרוּשָׁלִָ֑ם <S%H3389><s%> ye-ru-sha-Lim; which [is] Jerusalem וְעִמּ֗וֹ <S%H5973><s%> ve-'im-Mo, with צֶ֤מֶד <S%H6776><s%> Tze-med and [there were] with him two חֲמוֹרִים֙ <S%H2543><s%> cha-mo-Rim asses חֲבוּשִׁ֔ים <S%H2280><s%> cha-vu-Shim, saddled וּפִילַגְשׁ֖וֹ <S%H6370><s%> u-fi-lag-Sho his concubine עִמּֽוֹ׃ <S%H5973><s%> im-Mo. with

הֵ֣ם <S%H1992><s%> hem When עִם־ <S%H5973><s%> 'im- they near יְב֔וּס <S%H2982><s%> ye-Vus, [And] when they [were] by Jebus וְהַיּ֖וֹם <S%H3117><s%> ve-hai-Yom the day רַ֣ד <S%H7286><s%> rad spent מְאֹ֑ד <S%H3966><s%> me-'Od; was far וַיֹּ֨אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer said הַנַּ֜עַר <S%H5288><s%> han-Na-'ar and the servant אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to his אֲדֹנָ֗יו <S%H113><s%> 'a-do-Nav, unto his master לְכָה־ <S%H1980><s%> le-chah- come נָּ֛א <S%H4994><s%> na Please וְנָס֛וּרָה <S%H5493><s%> ve-na-Su-rah I pray thee and let us turn in אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about עִֽיר־ <S%H5892><s%> 'ir- into this city הַיְבוּסִ֥י <S%H2983><s%> hay-vu-Si of the Jebusites הַזֹּ֖את <S%H2063><s%> haz-Zot likewise וְנָלִ֥ין <S%H3885><s%> ve-na-Lin and lodge בָּֽהּ׃ Bah.

וַיֹּ֤אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer said אֵלָיו֙ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lav about אֲדֹנָ֔יו <S%H113><s%> 'a-do-Nav, And his master לֹ֤א <S%H3808><s%> lo We will not נָסוּר֙ <S%H5493><s%> na-Sur unto him We will not turn aside אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- into עִ֣יר <S%H5892><s%> 'ir hither into the city נָכְרִ֔י <S%H5237><s%> na-che-Ri, of a stranger אֲשֶׁ֛ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher who לֹֽא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- are not מִבְּנֵ֥י <S%H1121><s%> mib-be-Nei that [is] not of the children יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל <S%H3478><s%> Yis-ra-'El of Israel הֵ֑נָּה <S%H2008><s%> Hen-nah; here וְעָבַ֖רְנוּ <S%H5674><s%> ve-'a-Var-nu we will pass over עַד־ <S%H5704><s%> 'ad- far גִּבְעָֽה׃ <S%H1390><s%> giv-'Ah. to Gibeah

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said לְנַעֲר֔וֹ <S%H5288><s%> le-na-'a-Ro, unto his servant לְךָ֥ <S%H1980><s%> le-Cha Come וְנִקְרְבָ֖ה <S%H7126><s%> ve-nik-re-Vah and let us draw near בְּאַחַ֣ד <S%H259><s%> be-'a-Chad to one הַמְּקֹמ֑וֹת <S%H4725><s%> ham-me-ko-Mot; of these places וְלַ֥נּוּ <S%H3885><s%> ve-Lan-nu to lodge all night בַגִּבְעָ֖ה <S%H1390><s%> vag-giv-'Ah in Gibeah א֥וֹ <S%H176><s%> o or בָרָמָֽה׃ <S%H7414><s%> va-ra-Mah. or in Ramah

וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ <S%H5674><s%> vai-ya-'av-Ru And they passed on וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ <S%H1980><s%> vai-ye-Le-chu; and went וַתָּבֹ֤א <S%H935><s%> vat-ta-Vo went down לָהֶם֙ la-Hem הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ <S%H8121><s%> hash-She-mesh, and the sun אֵ֥צֶל <S%H681><s%> 'E-tzel upon them [when they were] by הַגִּבְעָ֖ה <S%H1390><s%> hag-giv-'Ah Gibeah אֲשֶׁ֥ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher which לְבִנְיָמִֽן׃ <S%H1144><s%> le-vin-ya-Min. which [belongeth] to Benjamin

וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ <S%H5493><s%> vai-ya-Su-ru And they turned aside שָׁ֔ם <S%H8033><s%> Sham, there לָב֖וֹא <S%H935><s%> la-Vo thither to go in לָל֣וּן <S%H3885><s%> la-Lun [and] to lodge בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה <S%H1390><s%> bag-giv-'Ah; in Gibeah וַיָּבֹ֗א <S%H935><s%> vai-ya-Vo, and when he went in וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ <S%H3427><s%> vai-Ye-shev he sat him down בִּרְח֣וֹב <S%H7339><s%> bir-Chov in a street הָעִ֔יר <S%H5892><s%> ha-'Ir, of the city וְאֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> ve-'Ein no אִ֛ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'ish for [there was] no man מְאַסֵּֽף־ <S%H622><s%> me-'as-sef- that took אוֹתָ֥ם <S%H853><s%> o-Tam הַבַּ֖יְתָה <S%H1004><s%> hab-Bay-tah them into his house לָלֽוּן׃ <S%H3885><s%> la-Lun. to lodging
